p: Choi et al. [ 85] isolated a novel seco-illudoid sesquiterpene, pterosinone( 1) from the ethanolic extract of Pteridium aquilinum. Pterosinone was reported to have mild inhibitory activity against acetyl and butyl cholinesterase enzymes with IC 50 = 88 μM and 73 μM, respectively. It was concluded from the results that sesquiterpenoids could be useful in treating AD. Chougouo et al. [ 51] isolated artemisinin ( 2) and chrysosplenetin ( 3) from the ethanol extract of Artemisia annua Linn. for the modulation of anticholinesterase (AChE) activity. The crude extract with artemisinin and chrysosplenetin showed the inhibition of AChE activity by 72% and 80% at 0.1 mg/mL with IC 50 of 104 µM and 73 µM.This study supported the possible use of these two compounds in neurological disorders including AD.
